title: Two Italy greats denied World Cup swansong as Typhoon Hagibis wreaks logistical havoc in Japan
text:
Spare a thought in the middle of the logistical chaos Typhoon Hagibis has created for two Italian gladiators who have been denied the grandest of farewells against New Zealand.

Leonardo Ghiraldini ruptured his anterior cruciate ligament at the end of March, putting his bid to play in a fourth Rugby World Cup in serious jeopardy.

Remarkably, given his age at 34, he recovered in time to be named as part of the squad but has not played a minute yet in Japan, saved for Italy’s final match against New Zealand when Conor O’Shea, the Italy head coach, planned to give him a deserved 20-minute...
description: Spare a thought in the middle of the logistical chaos Typhoon Hagibis has created for two Italian gladiators who have been denied the grandest of farewells against New Zealand.
